data.title: Basic Cipher
data.solution:
alphabet = "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ"

shift = int(input())
plaintext = input()
encrypted = ""

for char in plaintext:
    if char.isalpha():
        index = ord(char)-(65+shift)
        encrypted += alphabet[index]
    else:
        encrypted += char

print(encrypted)
data.statement:
In cryptography, a Caesar cipher, also known as the shift cipher, is one of the simplest and most widely known encryption techniques. It is a type of substitution cipher in which each letter in the plaintext is replaced by a letter some fixed number of positions down the alphabet. For example, with a left shift of 3, D would be replaced by A, E would become B, and so on.

Given 2 lines of input, an integer [[shift]] and a string [[plaintext]], you must output the result of applying a shift of [[shift]] characters to the <<left>> on [[plaintext]]

All characters in [[plaintext]] will be uppercase letters, numbers or symbols. Uppercase letters should be changed according to [[shift]], numbers and symbols should be the same in the output as they are in [[plaintext]].

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

In cryptography, a Caesar cipher, also known as the shift cipher, is one of the simplest and most widely known encryption techniques. It is a type of substitution cipher in which each letter in the plaintext is replaced by a letter some fixed number of positions down the alphabet. For example, with a left shift of 3, D would be replaced by A, E would become B, and so on.

Given 2 lines of input, an integer shift and a string plaintext, you must output the result of applying a shift of shift characters to the left on plaintext

All characters in plaintext will be uppercase letters, numbers or symbols. Uppercase letters should be changed according to shift, numbers and symbols should be the same in the output as they are in plaintext.
Input
Line 1: An integer shift - the number of characters to shift each character in the text.
Line 2: A string plaintext - the text to apply the cipher to. (ALL UPPERCASE)
Output
A string - the string produced by applying the cipher to plaintext
Constraints
0 ≤ shift ≤ 25
1 ≤ Length of plaintext ≤ 50
Example
Input
2
HELLO WORLD
Output
FCJJM UMPJB
